messageBody:
madhu_dhavala wrote:
> Hello group ... recently i joined this group ..I have some quires on
> junit testsuite method .. please help me ...
> I have one file with name say abc.java which extends TestCase ..inside
> that file i have many methods (all method names start with
> testXXXXX)...I know that in junit Testsuite you can pass .class
> name..but what iam looking for such a feature which will have some GUI
> (drag& drop)where you can select Java file and furuther methods from
> that particular java file and using drag& drop i can add into some
> suite file say with sample.suite ....if anybody implemented or some
> resources please send me.

Some IDEs allow you to build suites from multiple test case classes.
Eclipse allows this. Try creating a New > JUnit Test Suite to explore
what it does.

I have a few questions:

1. Do you truly want to create suites yourself? I usually just run all
the tests in a source tree or package. Most IDEs support this, as does Ant.

2. If you truly want to create suites yourself, do you truly want Drag &
Drop, or does it just have to be easy to create suites?

Take care.
